thread.title: Maruti Suzuki Baleno hatchback launched

author: Rishabh Chakravorty
title: Maruti Suzuki Baleno hatchback launched
text:
Maruti Suzuki Baleno hatchback launched By Rishabh Chakravorty on October 26, 2015 at 4:55 PM Comments 
Maruti Suzuki Baleno has been launched in India with prices starting at Rs 4.99 lakh ex-showroom New Delhi. The new hatchback version of the Baleno will go up against Volkswagen Polo, Honda Jazz and Hyundai Elite i20. The premium hatchback segment is the hottest segment at the moment as the focus shifts from the compact SUV market. 
The Baleno’s petrol variant starts at Rs 4.99 lakh and goes up to Rs 7.01 lakh while the diesel variant starts at Rs 6.16 lakh and goes up to Rs 8.11 lakh. There is also a petrol variant mated to an automatic gearbox which starts at Rs 6.76 lakh. All prices mentioned in this post are ex-showroom New Delhi. [Also Watch: Maruti Suzuki Baleno 2015 spotted during road test ] 
The car will be available in five trim levels – Alpha, Sigma, Zeta and Delta with the Delta trim only available with the automatic variant. The premium NEXA Maruti dealerships already have the all-new Baleno on display. An excellent move by Maruti is that all variants irrespective of the trim level will sport ABS and EBD as a standard feature. [Also Read: Maruti launches Baleno priced at Rs 4.99 lakh ] 
The petrol variant of the car comes with a 1.2 litre K-Series engine. You can buy it with a 5-speed gearbox or as a CVT (Automatic gearbox). The petrol engine produces 84.3 PS power at 115 Nm torque and gives a maximum mileage of 21.4 kmpl. The diesel variant comes as 1.3 litre DDiS engine which comes with a 5-speed gearbox and produces 75 PS, 190 Nm torque and gives a mileage of 27.39 kmpl.
